alert.note: Alert for Sebastian (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 17 at 11:50PM CST until December 18 at 4:45AM CST by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 AM CST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of west central Arkansas and southeast Oklahoma, including the following counties, in west central Arkansas, Franklin and Sebastian. In southeast Oklahoma, Latimer and Le Flore. * WHEN...Until 345 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1150 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fort Smith... Poteau... Ozark... Charleston... Greenwood... Barling... Pocola... Heavener... Lavaca... Panama... Talihina... Wister... Hackett... Howe... Altus... Hartford... Huntington... Bonanza... Fanshawe... Branch... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
